info.name: Zander Martineau
info.tagline: I am a London-based Creative Technologist working at TMW.

portfolio.name: Lynx Africa 18th Anniversary
portfolio.description: The iconic Lynx Africa deoderant turns 18 this year and to celebrate I helped produce a Tumblr blog that publishes a new piece of artwork each day for 18 days.

portfolio.name: TMW Kickoff
portfolio.description:
Kickoff is a robust, adaptable and unopinionated front-end framework that is great starting point for any web site; we use for every project at TMW.

The framework includes a SASS-based, CSS framework (with all the usual resets and mixins), a responsive grid system; beautiful typographic styles; javascript plugins, utilities and a great set of boilerplates for most eventualities. This means that our devs can get up and running as quickly as possible and not have to worry about this tedious initial step.

portfolio.name: The Bar
portfolio.description:
theBar.com is a popular US cocktail resource; I was a member of the team who created the Western Europe version of this already popular site.

From UX to performance, every aspect of the site was improved and carefully considered. I created a special asset font for the site, this creates crisp, hiDpi friendly icons that look great at any resolution.
portfolio.skills: Front-end development; asset font creation, hiDPI

portfolio.name: Lynx Apollo Vote Boosters
portfolio.description:
Lynx is currently (Jan 2013) running a worldwide competition to send someone into space - the entrant with the most votes wins - they asked TMW to create a microsite to help entrants promote themselves and garner more votes.

We built a responsive, single-page app that allows entrants to create and share a poster or choose from one of many prewritten status messages. The site is interesting because it positions the user in space and changes the viewport on each sub-page. As well as being project lead, I created the moving page navigation element and the more complex responsive features.

portfolio.name: Brother Printers
portfolio.description:
Brother Printers asked TMW to create a microsite for the various printer ranges. Each page of this site is devoted to one range and uses campaign assets to give a more consistent look and feel across media.

I worked closely with the designer, Dawn Jenner, to create an engaging and appealing experience that promoted each product's features and enabled customers to make a more informed decision.

portfolio.name: Knorr Mobile
portfolio.description:
Knorr, the food and beverage company, needed a mobile site for their successful corporate presence in the UK, TMW were asked to create it for them.

I developed a simple, hiDPI ready, site as a counterpart to their desktop site that, that focused on performance and

portfolio.name: DrinkIQ
portfolio.description:
This app, developed for DrinkIQ, determines how many calories and units of alcohol you might have consumed.

It is a fully responsive site that features two very different layouts at each of the main breakpoints. Javascript templating by Handlebars is used to populate the site's content.

portfolio.name: Novalux Energy website
portfolio.description: Novalux's visual identity helped form the basis for their website design. I also designed the site and developed it using the ExpressionEngine CMS. It makes use of some great web fonts (served from Fontdeck), it is set in Proxima Nova and Clarendon.

portfolio.name: Novalux Energy Solutions visual identity
portfolio.description: Novalux Energy Solutions are experts in providing renewable and cost-effective energy solutions to businesses across the world. I was given the task of creating the Novalux visual identity.

portfolio.name: Datasift UI & iconography
portfolio.description:
DataSift is the leading platform for building applications with insights derived from the most popular social networks and news sources. NEVERBLAND were asked to create a WYSIWYG editor for customers to more easily create 'streams' within their system.

I designed a huge library of icons and the UI for the WYSIWYG editor itself. I left NEVERBLAND half-way through this project so what you see now is an updated version of the work that I did.

portfolio.name: Colette
portfolio.description:
Colette is a department store based in Paris. NEVERBLAND were asked to pitch for a redesign of their existing ecommerce offering.

I produced this design for the home page, you can see three states: normal, navigation hovered and page content hovered. Unfortunately our ideas were not chosen and at time of writing, Colette still have not redesigned their site.

portfolio.name: Shift 4
portfolio.description:
Shift 4 are a broadcast facility company for film and TV in the UK. NEVERBLAND were asked to revamp and extend their existing site. We added a full equipment listing, with wishlist (think shopping list) feature; a blog and various other sections that overall helped customers engage with the company.

I designed & developed the front-end for this project making it fully responsive & adaptable to any device that uses it.

portfolio.name: Conversocial
portfolio.description: Conversocial is a Social Media management app for marketers and brands. NEVERBLAND were asked to redesign & develop their existing website. What you see below is my design for their home page, which unfortunately, was never used, however, many aspects were used in the final site. Conversocial have since redesigned their homepage so NEVERBLAND's version can be seen here.

portfolio.name: Soho Fixed
portfolio.description: Soho Fixed is a site where you can buy custom-made, fixed-gear or single-speed bycycles. I designed and developed the entire project - pay attention to the header with it's animating background image and the hover effect on the navigation. All non-bike photography was also shot by me.

portfolio.name: Soho Fixed visual identity
portfolio.description: As well as creating the website, I was given the task of creating the Soho Fixed visual identity. I kept it simple and bold because it was for stickers on each bike. The logo can also be separated, for example: the shield can be used on the head tube and the wording on the down tube.

open-source.title: Open Source Projects
open-source.description: Below are a few open source projects that I maintain and contribute to.

items.name: Social Homepage
items.description: My version of a social home page/business card site. You can see it at mrmartineau.co.uk. Please use it for yourself by forking the project on Github

items.name: Sublime Text Setup
items.description: This project aims to enable people to get started with Sublime Text 2 much more quickly. It includes a list of recommended plugins and useful defaults for some plugins and settings.

items.name: SASS Snippets
items.description: A collection of Sublime Text 2 snippets & functions to be used with SASS. Most snippets are to be used specifically with .scss

items.name: The Choreographic Grid
items.description:
A responsive CSS grid for content interdigitation, built with SASS for today's modern websites. Instead of using poorly supported features of modern CSS (I'm looking at you, Flex box), it uses floats but has some sneaky tricks up it's sleeve.

As well as standard grid features, I created two new features that help when creating responsive sites, these are 'Shunts' and 'Splits'. Find out more at the project demo.

items.name: TMW Kickoff
items.description:
Kickoff is a robust, adaptable and unopinionated front-end framework that is great starting point for any web site; we use for every project at TMW.

The framework includes a SASS-based, CSS framework (with all the usual resets and mixins), a responsive grid system; beautiful typographic styles; javascript plugins, utilities and a great set of boilerplates for most eventualities. This means that our devs can get up and running as quickly as possible and not have to worry about this tedious initial step.

items.name: Javascript-less Social links
items.description: If you've ever needed to share a web page on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest without using each of their verbose javascript widgets, use these links instead.

sublime.title: Sublime Text resources
sublime.description: Sublime Text is my code editor of choice. It is fast, extremely extendible and I highly recommend that you use it if you are a front-end web developer. Here I present some plugins and snippets that will help to improve your experience with this code editor.

items.name: Sublime Text Setup
items.description: This project aims to enable people to get started with Sublime Text 2 much more quickly. It includes a list of recommended plugins and useful defaults for some plugins and settings.

items.name: SASS Snippets
items.description: A collection of Sublime Text 2 snippets & functions to be used with SASS. Most snippets are to be used specifically with .scss

items.name: jQuery
items.description: Sublime Text package bundle for jQuery. It features

items.name: Placeholders
items.description: Placeholder HTML & content (lorem ipsum) package for Sublime Text
